ЁЯУЪ
Patrons of the Tamil Sangam

The Pandya kings are considered the greatest patrons of the Tamil language. According to legends, they organized three literary assemblies (Sangams). Madurai was their capital and cultural center. The poem 'Maduraikanchi' provides a detailed description of the Pandya country and capital.

ЁЯРЯ
Nedunchezhian and Korkai

Nedunchezhian 'Thalaiyalamganam' was the most famous Sangam Pandya king. Korkai was their main port, which was a center for pearl fishery. Their coins are found with figures of fish on one side and an elephant or bull on the other.

ЁЯМК
Foreign Contacts

Pandyan envoys visited the court of the Roman Emperor Augustus. Greek and Roman accounts mention the Pandya kingdom, indicating their extensive international contacts.
